snippet: A revised Constitution validating the military takeover in Egypt appeared headed for approval, according to early tabulations, as international monitors questioned the fairness of the vote.
abstract: Early tabulations in Egypt's official and private news media show that country's revised Constitution, which validates military takeover this past summer, appears headed for lopsided approval by more than 90 percent of the votes cast; international monitors question fairness of the vote.
lead_paragraph: A revised Constitution validating the military takeover in Egypt appeared headed for approval, according to early tabulations, as international monitors questioned the fairness of the vote.

headline.main: Early Tallies Show Revised Charter Passing in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Early Tallies Show Revised Charter Passing in Egypt
